Pre-Game Insights: India have to win the third ODI against Sri Lanka to square the three-match series 1-1.
Sri Lanka picked up a huge win over India in the second ODI with an inspiring performance from their bowling unit.
The Indian batting lineup has batted quite poorly as a unit in the first two ODIs of the series except for the captain Rohit Sharma, who scored two quick-fire fifties in a row on difficult pitches.
The bowling attack of India has done its job reasonably well in the ODI series, with the pacers and spinners sharing the wickets amongst themselves in equal measure.
